body: LEAD: New York City has begun to reverse a legacy of physical decline. body: LEAD: THE FOOD DAY BEGINS shortly before midnight at the Hunts Point Terminal Market in the Bronx. It is a militaristic-looking complex in a wasteland of auto wreckers and junkyards. title: THE ULTIMATE MARKETPLACE; Working to Feed the City - the Butcher, the Baker ... the Marketplace Maker

body: LEAD: Every afternoon at 3 o'clock, a private patrol car begins rolling through one of the prettiest neighborhoods in Brooklyn. It cruises under canopies of ailanthus and maple trees, past unbroken rows of 19th-century brownstones, chocolate-rich and crisply preserved, with their jaunty window bays and welcoming stoops. title: In Enclave, Mayor's Race Hinges on Crime

body: LEAD: The world of Jamez Williams's Bedford-Stuyvesant childhood flickered large before his eyes.
